clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Consumption of Orafti® Inulin on Bowel Motor Function in Subjects With Constipation
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Consumption of Inulin on Bowel Motor Function in Subjects With Constipation

brief_summary.textblock: Investigation of the effects of a four week daily consumption of Orafti® Inulin on bowel motor function in subjects with constipation.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Stool frequency determined by daily questionnaire
primary_outcome.description: Stool frequency determined by daily questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.measure: Stool consistency rated according to the Bristol Stool Form Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Stool consistency rated according to the Bristol Stool Form Scale from Type 1 to Type 7.

Sensation of straining, abdominal discomfort, bloating/distension, passage of gas and feeling of incomplete emptying rated on a 5-point scale (0 = not at all, 1 = very slightly, 2 = slightly, 3 = moderately, 4 = extremely).

secondary_outcome.measure: Questionnaire on Participant Assessment of Constipation Quality of Life (PAC-QoL)
secondary_outcome.description: Severity of each symptom rated on a five-point scale from 0 (not at all / none of the time) to 4 (extremely / all of the time).

secondary_outcome.measure: Faecal microbiota composition determined by illumina sequencing
Stool metabolite profiling determined by GC/LC-MS

arm_group.description: Daily consumption of 12g Orafti® Inulin (3x 4g/d) over a period of 4 weeks
Daily consumption of 12g/ Maltodextrin (3x 4g/d) over a period of 4 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy volunteers without clinical diagnosed diseases with relevant effect on the gastrointestinal system or on visceral motility.
- Constipation defined as an average of 2-3 stools per week. Volunteers should have had constipation for at least the previous 6 months.
- Age ≥ 20 and ≤ 75
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject under prescription for medication for digestive symptoms such as antispasmodic, laxatives, anti-diarrheic drugs or other digestive auxiliaries.
- Relevant history, presence of any medical disorder or chronic intake of medication/dietary supplements potentially interfering with this trial.
- Subjects with stool frequency of <1 stool every 7 days or more than 3 stools per week.
